name: 2025 Toronto Jewish Film Festival
description:
Now in its 33rd edition! The festival will be taking a hybrid approach with a selection of virtual screenings available, making content accessible to a wider audience. 

The festival will screen over 80 films from Canada, France, Italy, Germany, Portugal, Poland, Israel and more, screening at various Toronto locations. From horror to comedy to poignant documentaries, free programmes and engaging panels, discover the unexpected at the festival.

name: Eggsquisite Designs: Cracking the Science of Bird Eggs with Mark Peck

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Note: Pre-registration is required for all our events, hikes and workshops. We do this to ensure we don’t exceed our capacity for indoor events or the maximum limits for group sizes on High Park’s ecologically sensitive trails.

Join Mark Peck for an egg-citing dive into the world of bird eggs! Learn about their incredible colors, shapes, and adaptations, plus the unique nests that keep them safe. After the talk, we’ll explore the park to spot the birds that lay these tiny natural wonders.

name: The Green Summit 2025
description:
Join us for this annual, one-day networking event that drives sustainability, innovation, and collaboration with meaningful discussions and actionable solutions for a more sustainable world. It connects change-makers, and industry leaders from diverse sectors to accelerate green transformation. 

After two successful annual events in 2023 and 2024, the Green Summit continues to grow as a key hub for sustainable transformation. Now, as we move into 2025, the momentum builds stronger.

name: Thursday Night Dinner Fiddle and Banjo with Porch Couch
description: Alan Mackie and Jaron Freeman-Fox come together to reanimate old-time and square dance tunes on the fiddle and banjo, channeling a deep respect for the tradition through their adventurous, comical and psychedelic spirit. A decade of touring together in more bands than they can count has gotten Jaron and Alan mixed up in some of the most absurd music in the world, from Norway to Hungary to Tuva and back home, 9-string fiddles and shrieking folk dancers and jazz throat singers flying past at every turn.

name: HAG Finale Event
description:
We started He’s A Guy to have the convos we never heard growing up about identity, masculinity, relationships, wellness, and everything in between. 

It’s been raw, real, and now we’re going live. We’re bringing the laughs, the honesty, and the tough conversations and we want you in the room.

This isn’t just an event. It’s a space for growth, bold conversations, and real connection.
We’ve got a lot packed!

name: Joi Murugavell - TODAY WATCHING YESTERDAY (family reunion)
description:
Step into a world where art transcends time and space! 

We invite you to the exclusive Canadian debut of the extraordinary Joi Murugavell.

Joi’s artwork is an explosion of colour and emotion, featuring unique characters that invite you to explore the playful yet profound narratives behind each piece. With her Master’s degree in Art and Design from Auckland University and a diverse portfolio exhibited around the globe, Joi’s work is a stunning fusion of abstract forms and vibrant hues. Each character embodies a rich tapestry of human experiences—celebrating joy, navigating struggle, and everything in between.

Join us for an evening filled with inspiration, creativity, and community.

name: Canary District - Movement and Migration Walking Tour

location.name: Tour begins at the southeast corner of Cherry St and Front St E

description:
Once a bustling hub for Irish immigrants, railway workers, and travelers passing through the famous Palace Street School turned Cherry Hotel turned Canary Restaurant, discover the landmarks of the Canary District that date back to the early 19th century, and the stories they tell of connection and transition.

This two kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Deena Shirkool. Deena is a recent graduate in archaeology, and currently works as an education interpreter. As a 1.5-generation Iranian immigrant, Deena became interested in how people's connection to the land changes over time.

name: Northern Lights Painting Workshop
description: With step-by-step guidance, you'll create your own colourful night sky masterpiece while enjoying tea in a relaxed, inspiring atmosphere. No experience needed.

name: Mzawe Kiing Anishinaabek Giizis - National Indigenous Peoples Month
description:
A time to celebrate the rich cultures, histories, and contributions of First Nations, Inuit and Métis Peoples. 

Join us in honouring Indigenous voices, experiences and achievements. All are welcome.

name: The Fratchelor - Red Flags
description:
A comedic and interactive drag "dating show" where audience members have an opportunity to win tickets to Frat Haus: Evicted at the Toronto Fringe Festival!

With wildly seductive performances to introduce our fratchelors, hilarious audience participation games, and a bachelor-style dating simulator, it will be up to our audience and participants to decide which drag king has the least amount of red flags.

name: Tote Bag Painting and Pressing Workshop
description: Design your own custom tote bag in this playful, hands-on workshop! Choose to paint directly or scan your art and heat press it onto your bag. We'll provide the tools, guidance, and plenty of room for creative freedom.

name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Sanderson Library
description: The Sanderson Branch and its neighbourhood is home to a variety of trees. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to explore the natural world on a local neighbourhood walk. Learn how to recognize different species and fun facts about their cultural and ecological importance. Please note, the tour will start and end at the Sanderson Branch and will be guided by the City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff. There may be uneven, unpaved surfaces along the route outside and around the neighbourhood. Please dress and prepare accordingly for this outdoor program. This program takes place rain or shine. In the event of severe inclement weather, please register with the branch to be notified of an alternative date.

organizer.name: Urban Forestry, Natural Environment and Community Programs

name: Music In St. James Park

location.name: Michael Comstock Pavilion in St. James Park

description: Bring a chair, or blanket for the back lawn, and pack a picnic to enjoy while local musicians take to the stage. Feel like dancing? Step on up and show us your moves.

name: Pup Quiz! Dog-Friendly Trivia at Stout Irish Pub
description: Have a paws-itively fun night of trivia with your best pals and your best pups! Test your knowledge on all things dog-related, pop culture, music and other fun categories while enjoying some delicious food and drink. Bring your pup along to enjoy the company of other dog owners and maybe even win some prizes. Don't miss out on this tail-wagging good time.
